description: Numerators in partial products of the twin prime constant.
comments: For n>1, a(n) is the absolute value of the numerator of the determinant of the n X n matrix with elements M[i,j] = 1/(Prime[i]-1)^2 for i=j and 1 otherwise. - _Alexander Adamchuk_, Jun 02 2006
references: S. R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge, 2003, pp. 84-94.
G. H. Hardy and E. M. Wright, An Introduction to the Theory of Numbers, 5th ed., Oxford Univ. Press, 1979, ch. 22.20
mathematica: Numerator[Abs[Table[ Det[ DiagonalMatrix[ Table[ 1/(Prime[i]-1)^2 - 1, {i, 1, n} ] ] + 1 ], {n, 2, 20} ]]] - _Alexander Adamchuk_, Jun 02 2006
author: _Frank Ellermann_, Jun 16 2001
extensions: Typo in link corrected by Martin Griffiths (griffm(AT)essex.ac.uk), Apr 03 2009
